results.title: The High wall
results.creator_credit: Michael Road, Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith and Columbia Foundation of San Francisco
results.brief_description: Traces a prejudice against immigrants from its beginnings to its development into a socially damaging outburst. In the dramatisation, Tom Gregory’s father, frustrated in his white-collar job, has contaminated his son with the anti-Polish feeling which lets out his repressed hatreds. Tom’s mother also influences the boy with her defensive hostility to different ways of life. Doctors and social workers become involved after Tom’s teenage gang attacks a party in the home of a Polish teenager. The social worker reveals the causes of the teenage riot.

results.title: The Hard core
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zegart and International Refugee Organization. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: Film deals with the “hard core” on intellectuals and invalid war victims remaining in the displaced persons’ camps in Europe and shows the steps already taken by the International Refugee Organisation to alleviate the suffering of these special groups and try to find homes for them in other countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Zegart and International Refugee Organization. Office of Public Information

results.title: The Hague - Holland
results.creator_credit: Caspar Willers, Hans Vos, Carrilon Films and Holland
results.brief_description: The capital of the Netherlands is a felicitous mixture of the old and the new. The film explores the city and the cultural and international events that take place there.

results.title: The Growing of a young filmaker
results.brief_description: A documentary about a high school dropout. Uses scenes and narrative from movies which he made to show how his attitude toward learning was changed from apathy to zeal by his movie-making experiences.

results.title: The Greeks in search of meaning
results.creator_credit: Helen Jean Secondari and John H. Secondari
results.brief_description: Recreates the concerns and achievements of the Greeks in the 5th century B.C. Eternal philosophical and moral debates are dramatised through the dialogues of the era’s great thinkers. Includes excerpts from Antigone by Sophocles, and Lysistrata by Aristophanes.

results.title: The Great Mill race
results.creator_credit: Robin Crichton and Edinburgh Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.
results.description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.

results.title: The Missing interest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem”.
A dramatised case problem which can lead to searching discussion of methods of developing employee involvement and interest in low level narrow scope jobs. Supervisors can identify and project themselves into the situation. The film poses but does not answer a basic problem.

results.title: In the middle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
The supervisor in order to avoid getting rid of staff when work is slack arranged for a transfer of his best typist to another section. Unfortunately he neglects to explain to her why he has recommended the transfer and she thinks it is because he considers her work to be poor. She complains to his superior officer, which causes trouble for the supervisor. Discussion is on how the situation could have been avoided.

results.title: The Bright young newcomer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem Series”.
One of a series of six films designed to help supervision and middle management improve human relations in the office. By failing to properly channel the initiative of the bright young newcomer, the supervisor is presented with an unpleasant ultimatum by his senior clerk. For the audience to discuss is the question as to what the supervisor could have done to avoid friction among the staff.
